lifestyleSection: Living in San Javier as a holiday homeowner means embracing a rhythm of leisurely mornings, afternoon siesta culture, and evening paseos through charming local streets. The established expat community ensures you'll never feel out of place—English is widely spoken, and numerous social groups cater to international residents. faqs.question: Hur mycket kostar denna fastighet?
faqs.answer: €359,000. This 3-bedroom bungalow in Roda Golf offers premium specification at €3,779 per square meter—40% less expensive than comparable properties in Spanish island markets like Ibiza or Mallorca. Flexible payment arrangements can be discussed with the sales team.

faqs.question: Är Costa Blanca en bra plats att köpa fastighet?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Costa Blanca remains one of Spain's most popular regions for international property buyers, offering excellent value, established infrastructure, and strong rental potential. The region is experiencing 8% year-on-year market growth, with San Javier specifically attracting serious investors seeking authentic Mediterranean living beyond the overcrowded coastal resorts.

faqs.question: Kan utlänningar köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain without restrictions. You'll need a NIE (tax identification number), open a Spanish bank account, and engage a Spanish solicitor—straightforward procedures handled by established property firms. Most international buyers complete purchases within 4-6 weeks.

faqs.question: Vilka är kostnaderna för att köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Beyond the €359,000 purchase price, expect approximately 8-10% in additional costs: 6-8% transfer tax (varies by region), notary fees (1%), and solicitor fees (1-2%). Annual property tax is roughly 0.4-0.6% of cadastral value (typically lower than actual market price). These costs are substantially lower than UK equivalents.

faqs.question: Hur är levnadskostnaderna på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers excellent value compared to northern Europe. Monthly living costs for a couple are typically €1,200-1,800 including utilities, food, and entertainment. Healthcare and dining are particularly affordable, while petrol and services cost significantly less than UK equivalents. Property ownership costs (tax, maintenance, utilities) average €300-400 monthly.

faqs.question: Vilken hyresintäkt kan jag förvänta mig från denna fastighet?
faqs.answer: Comparable properties in Roda Golf generate approximately €800 per week during peak seasons (May-September). Conservative estimates suggest €30,000-40,000 annually for dedicated rental periods. Many owners rent 8-10 weeks yearly while retaining personal use, generating meaningful returns that offset ownership costs entirely.

faqs.question: Hur långt är det från Sverige till Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport is just 40 minutes from San Javier, with direct flights to London, Manchester, and other UK airports (2-hour flight time). Many holiday homeowners fly out for extended breaks, making accessibility straightforward for maintaining connections with family and friends.

faqs.question: Hur är vädret på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Exceptional. Over 320 days of annual sunshine, with mild winters (average 15-17°C) and warm summers (28-30°C). Rainfall is minimal, typically 10-15 rainy days yearly. It's genuinely the sunniest region on mainland Spain, making it perfect for escaping northern winters.

faqs.question: Is San Javier good for holiday homeowners?
faqs.answer: Ideal. San Javier combines authentic Spanish atmosphere with excellent infrastructure, beaches within 20 minutes, championship golf courses, and an established international community. Unlike overcrowded coastal resorts, it offers genuine Mediterranean lifestyle with all modern conveniences. Property prices remain significantly more affordable than equivalent homes in Benidorm or Javea.

faqs.question: Behöver jag visum för att köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: No, purchasing property doesn't require a visa. However, if you plan extended stays (more than 90 days in any 180-day period), you'll need a residency visa—a straightforward process involving property ownership proof and financial documentation. Many holiday homeowners maintain tourist status with annual visits under 90 days.
